newsitem.title: UK: Deutsche Morgan Grenfell to face fines - paper.
newsitem.headline: Deutsche Morgan Grenfell to face fines - paper.

text.p: Deutsche Morgan Grenfell will face a fine of more than one million stg and will be required to repatriate up to 200 million to make good losses to investors in its troubled asset management group, Britain's Guardian newspaper said on Saturday.

In an unsourced report, The Guardian said that investment fund management regulators Investment Management Regulatory Organisation (IMRO) would announce stiff fines and other penalties early next year following investigations into misvaluation of three of Deutsche Morgan Grenfell funds.
Neither IMRO nor Deutsche Morgan Grenfell could be contacted for comment on the report.
The Guardian said that IMRO planned to make Deutsche Morgan Grenfell "make good every penny of investment returns" as well as impose a record-breaking one million stg fine.
The Guardian said that together with the 180 million stg already injected into the funds by owners Deutsche Bank, the total costs of the affair would reach some 400 million stg.

Deutsche Morgan Grenfell has already sacked Morgan Grenfell Asset Management fund manager Peter Young and four other senior managers following revelations of problems in three MGAM funds in September.

Trading in the funds, which were held by around 90,000 retail investors, resumed after Deutsche Bank stepped in with a 180 million stg cash injection. Both IMRO and Britain's Serious Fraud Office are conducting investigations.
